column1: --adjust-extension          save HTML/CSS documents with proper extensions
--bind-address=ADDRESS      bind to ADDRESS (hostname or IP) on local host
--body-data=STRING          send STRING as data. --method MUST be set
--body-file=FILE            send contents of FILE. --method MUST be set
--ca-certificate=FILE       file with the bundle of CAs
--ca-directory=DIR          directory where hash list of CAs is stored
--connect-timeout=SECS      set the connect timeout to SECS
--content-on-error          output the received content on server errors
--convert-file-only         convert the file part of the URLs only (usually known as the basename)
--convert-file-only can be used together only if outputting to a regular file.
--convert-links             make links in downloaded HTML or CSS point to
--delete-after              delete files locally after downloading them
--dns-timeout=SECS          set the DNS lookup timeout to SECS
--egd-file=FILE             file naming the EGD socket with random data
--follow-ftp                follow FTP links from HTML documents
--follow-tags=LIST          comma-separated list of followed HTML tags
--ftps-clear-data-connection    cipher the control channel only; all the data will be in plaintext
--ftps-fallback-to-ftp          fall back to FTP if FTPS is not supported in the target server
--ftps-resume-ssl               resume the SSL/TLS session started in the control connection when
--hsts-file                 path of HSTS database (will override default)
--ignore-tags=LIST          comma-separated list of ignored HTML tags
--input-file=FILE           download URLs found in local or external FILE
--input-metalink=FILE       download files covered in local Metalink FILE
--level=NUMBER              maximum recursion depth (inf or 0 for infinite)
--load-cookies=FILE         load cookies from FILE before session
--local-encoding=ENC        use ENC as the local encoding for IRIs
--metalink-over-http        use Metalink metadata from HTTP response headers
--no-clobber                skip downloads that would download to
--no-config                 do not read any config file
--no-glob                   turn off FTP file name globbing
--no-parent                 don't ascend to the parent directory
--no-use-server-timestamps  don't set the local file's timestamp by
--no-warc-compression       do not compress WARC files with GZIP
--no-warc-keep-log          do not store the log file in a WARC record
--password=PASS             set both ftp and http password to PASS
--post-data=STRING          use the POST method; send STRING as the data
--post-file=FILE            use the POST method; send contents of FILE
--random-file=FILE          file with random data for seeding the SSL PRNG
--read-timeout=SECS         set the read timeout to SECS
--referer=URL               include 'Referer: URL' header in HTTP request
--rejected-log=FILE         log reasons for URL rejection to FILE
--remote-encoding=ENC       use ENC as the default remote encoding
--report-speed=TYPE         output bandwidth as TYPE.  TYPE can be bits
--restrict-file-names=OS    restrict chars in file names to ones OS allows
--retry-connrefused         retry even if connection is refused
--save-cookies=FILE         save cookies to FILE after session
--save-headers              save the HTTP headers to file
--show-progress             display the progress bar in any verbosity mode
--span-hosts                go to foreign hosts when recursive
--start-pos and --continue is not recommended; --continue will be disabled.
--start-pos=OFFSET          start downloading from zero-based position OFFSET
--strict-comments           turn on strict (SGML) handling of HTML comments
--timeout=SECONDS           set all timeout values to SECONDS
--timestamping              don't re-retrieve files unless newer than
--tries=NUMBER              set number of retries to NUMBER (0 unlimits)
--trust-server-names        use the name specified by the redirection
--user-agent=AGENT          identify as AGENT instead of Wget/VERSION
--user=USER                 set both ftp and http user to USER
--version                   display the version of Wget and exit
--waitretry=SECONDS         wait 1..SECONDS between retries of a retrieval
--warc-dedup=FILENAME       do not store records listed in this CDX file
--warc-file=FILENAME        save request/response data to a .warc.gz file
--warc-header=STRING        insert STRING into the warcinfo record
--warc-max-size=NUMBER      set maximum size of WARC files to NUMBER
--warc-tempdir=DIRECTORY    location for temporary files created by the
--backups=N                 before writing file X, rotate up to N backup files
--certificate-type=TYPE     client certificate type, PEM or DER
--convert-file-only and -O if multiple URLs are given, or in combination
--no-clobber and --convert-file-only were specified, only --convert-file-only will be used.
--no-clobber and --convert-links were specified, only --convert-links will be used.
--no-verbose                turn off verboseness, without being quiet
--page-requisites           get all images, etc. needed to display HTML page
--pinnedpubkey=FILE/HASHES  Public key (PEM/DER) file, or any number
--prefer-family=FAMILY      connect first to addresses of specified family,
--private-key-type=TYPE     private key type, PEM or DER
--retr-symlinks             when recursing, get linked-to files (not dir)
--secure-protocol=PR        choose secure protocol, one of auto, SSLv2,
